titles.title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate regarding the constitutional right of State Governors to repel the dangerous ongoing invasion across the United States southern border.
A resolution to express the sense of the Senate regarding the constitutional right of State Governors to repel the dangerous ongoing invasion across the United States southern border.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: This resolution expresses the sense of the Senate that citizens in all 50 states have been endangered by President Biden's border policies. The resolution finds that violent activity and significant numbers of border crossings constitute invasion under the U.S. Constitution and expresses that state governors possess the authority to repel such invasion.
